sentences.english: Unfortunately, little clarity results from digging deeper into the numbers.
sentences.chinese: 令人遺憾的是，深挖之下也沒有多少透明結果。

sentences.english: Libing employed a method of channeling and dividing the water to harness the Minjiang Rivers.
sentences.chinese: 他用導流和深挖的手段來消除了岷江的水害。

sentences.english: Third, tap potential of cooperation and maintain the sustainability of the SCO’s development.
sentences.chinese: 第三，深挖合作潛力，增強本組織發展的持續後勁。

sentences.english: The press and her opponents would have a field day digging into the dirty details of her background.
sentences.chinese: 媒體和對手可以痛快地深挖她不堪入目的醜聞。

sentences.english: Dig deep within yourself, and you’ll come out (eventually) with even greater self-confidence.
sentences.chinese: 深挖自己的內心，您會最終以更大的自信。

sentences.english: Dig deep inside yourself and think about what are you passionate about right now.
sentences.chinese: 深挖自己，想想現在你最有熱情的事情是什麼。

sentences.english: Eg: I think we need to delve a little deeper.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲我們需要再深挖下。

sentences.english: Firstly, further tap the potential for cooperation.
One of the characteristics of highway construction is fill root out the road over the high embankment.
sentences.chinese: 高速公路建設的特點之一就是路基高填深挖路段多。

sentences.english: You need to be willing to dig deeply.
Well,okay yeah maybe so,but dig deeper.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，也許是對的，但再深挖一些。

sentences.english: Thispaper summarizes the problems of the heavy cutting projects.
sentences.chinese: 本文總結了深挖方路塹存在的問題。

definition: lit. to spin silk from cocoons/fig. to make a painstaking investigation (idiom)
to excavate/to dig out/fig. to investigate (in an archive)
deep plowing/thorough penetration/thorough development (of a market segment etc)
to excavate/to explore/(fig.) to unearth/to tap into
one step further/to move forward a step/further onwards
to investigate/to delve/to probe/to enquire into/to look into
